newsitem.title: INDIA: India says fertiliser policy delayed.
newsitem.headline: India says fertiliser policy delayed.

text.p: The Indian government's new fertiliser policy has been delayed by several months, Chemicals and Fertiliser Minister M. Arunachalam said on Thursday.
"We hope to have the Hanumant Rao committee report any time now, and will then start formulating the policy," Arunachalam told a news conference.
He said the committee report had been delayed, postponing the whole process.
The government decided in January 1997 to form a committee to study fertiliser pricing, availability and subsidies. The committee was to submit its report on June 1.
The minister said that the availability of fertiliser was satisfactory this year, and that farmers had not had problems in procurement.

He said that two government-owned fertiliser makers, Hindustan Fertiliser Corporation and Fertiliser Corporation of India, were not doing well. "We are looking at various possibilities to set them right," he said without elaborating.
